sentences.english: When that happens, children have “the guardian angel installed behind the tongue”.
sentences.chinese: 当这些能实现时，孩子们的语言便有如天使护佑。

sentences.english: Mataji claims he was blessed by the Hindu goddess Amba when he was just eight.
sentences.chinese: 贾尼称，在他8岁时，就得到了印度女神安巴的护佑。
小小羔羊儿，愿主护佑你。

sentences.english: The peach have the traits of expelling evil spirits and safeguarding life.
sentences.chinese: 桃还有驱邪避鬼，护佑生命的特质。

sentences.english: So they had been protected for a long time by royal families.
sentences.chinese: 这使得何氏家族长期获得皇权的护佑。

sentences.english: May Buddhas and Bodhisattvas Bless you and keep you.
sentences.chinese: 愿佛菩萨祝福及护佑你。

sentences.english: Mataji claims he was blessed by the Hindu goddess Amba when he was just eight。
sentences.chinese: 贾尼称，在他8岁时，就得到了印度女神安巴的护佑。

sentences.english: God sometimes does try to the uttermost those whom he wishes to bless.
sentences.chinese: 上帝有时的确会最大程度去护佑那些祈求福佑的人。

sentences.english: For the Lord will be at thy side, and will keep thy foot that thou be not taken.
sentences.chinese: 因为上主将要护佑你，使你的脚远离陷阱。

sentences.english: who blesses us with the Dharma?
Send Thy Guardian Angel to guard and protect me from all evil.
sentences.chinese: 差遣你的护守天使，守卫护佑我免于一切凶恶。

definition: asylum/shelter/to shield/to put under protection/to take under one's wing
to care for/to show concern for/to think longingly (of one's country)
to pray/to pray for sth/to wish sth/prayer/wish
misfortune turns to blessing (idiom); to turn an inauspicious start to good account
(of a supernatural or divine being) to appear/to make itself manifest
favor from an emperor or high official
favorable weather (idiom); good weather for crops
to help one another/to come to sb's help
